(static) delimitString(str, delimiter, delimiters)

Source:
  • string/delimitString.js, line 16
Example
delimitString('fooBar', '_') // 'foo_Bar'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
str String

string of any casing
delimiter String

e.g. '_'
delimiters Array

optional. An array of delimiter characters on which this function searches and breaks. Defaults to checking -, _, and space
Returns:

a new string with the specified delimiter delimiting each word

(static) mapString(str, charMapper)

Source:
  • string/mapString.js, line 15

Maps a string by applying function charMapper to each character.

Example
mapString("hello", c => c === 'h' ? 'x' : c) // returns 'xello'
Parameters:
Name Type Description
str string

to be mapped
charMapper function

function of form (character) =>

Returns:

a new string, with each character mapped by charMap. If str is not a string or charMapper not a function, just returns str

(static) template(template, data, fallback) → {string}

Source:
  • string/template.js, line 19

Simple template replace for ES6 template strings

Example
template('${ who } in ${ where }!', { who: 'goats', where: 'boats' })
// Returns "goats in boats"
Parameters:
Name Type Description
template string

String with ES6 syntax items to be replaced
data Object | Array

Data used to replace the ES6 placeholders
fallback any

Used it data does not contain key to be replaced
Returns:
  • template with placeholder values filled
Type
string

Name Type Description

Simple template replace for ES6 template strings

Example

Parameters:
Name Type Description

data Object | Array

fallback any

Used it data does not contain key to be replaced
Returns:
  • template with placeholder values filled

charMapper function

Simple template replace for ES6 template strings

Example
template('${ who } in ${ where }!', { who: 'goats', where: 'boats' })

Name Type Description

data Object | Array

fallback any

Returns:
  • template with placeholder values filled

Example

Parameters:
Name Type Description

string of any casing
delimiter String

e.g. '_'
delimiters Array

optional. An array of delimiter characters on which this function searches and breaks. Defaults to checking -, _, and space
Returns:

a new string with the specified delimiter delimiting each word

Source:
  • string/template.js, line 19

Simple template replace for ES6 template strings

Example
template('${ who } in ${ where }!', { who: 'goats', where: 'boats' })
// Returns "goats in boats"
Parameters:
Name Type Description
template string

String with ES6 syntax items to be replaced
data Object | Array

Data used to replace the ES6 placeholders
fallback any

Used it data does not contain key to be replaced
Returns:
  • template with placeholder values filled
Type
string

Parameters:
Name Type Description

Returns:

a new string with the specified delimiter delimiting each word

Maps a string by applying function charMapper to each character.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

to be mapped
charMapper function

function of form (character) =>

Returns:

a new string, with each character mapped by charMap. If str is not a string or charMapper not a function, just returns str
